title-group.article-title: The K-Operator and the Galerkin Method for Strongly Elliptic Equations on Smooth Curves: Local Estimates

abstract.p: Superconvergence in the L<sup>2</sup>-norm for the Galerkin approximation of the integral equation Lu = f is studied, where L is a strongly elliptic pseudodifferential operator on a smooth, closed or open curve. Let u<sub>h</sub> be the Galerkin approximation to u. By using the K-operator, an operator that averages the values of u<sub>h</sub>, we will construct a better approximation than u<sub>h</sub> itself. That better approximation is a legacy of the highest order of convergence in negative norms. For Symm's equation on a slit the same order of convergence can be recovered if the mesh is suitably graded.
